result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanner D. Roth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit DNA sample. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Complete domestic abuse counseling. Same conditions for count 3.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

10:27 AM Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Tanner D. Roth in court.  Attorney Richard G. Davis Jr. in court for Tanner D. Roth. Agreement recited by State. Information filed, reading waived. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 2, & 3. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Counts 1 & 4 dismissed and read in. Sentencing statements. Court withheld sentence, placed the defendant on probation for 2 years each count. Conditions of probation include: Submit DNA sample. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Complete domestic abuse counseling. Fines and costs on count 2 of $679.00, and costs on count 3 of $268.00. 3 days sentence credit. 10:37 AM
Arraignment 8-10-22 at 10:00 am
Filed by Atty Richard Davis

Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Attorney Davis requested an arraignment date.
Arraignment scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
